definition: to record/to note/to memorize/to remember/mark/sign/classifier for blows, kicks, shots

sentences.english: Shorthand and typewriting have been described as the twin arts.
sentences.chinese: 速記和打字被說成是一對孿生技巧。

sentences.english: They prepared to take down what he would say in shorthand.
sentences.chinese: 他們準備用速記來記錄他將說的話。

sentences.english: He dashed into the inner office. He charged upon the desk of the stenographer.
sentences.chinese: 他箭步衝進裏間辦公室，向速記員的辦公桌衝過去。

sentences.english: I've passed the tests of business skills for abacus and shorthand.
sentences.chinese: 我通過了珠算和速記的商業技能考試。

sentences.english: Stenography is an essential part of secretarial work.
sentences.chinese: 速記是祕書工作中重要的一項。

sentences.english: I: How are your typing and shorthand skills?
sentences.chinese: 你的打字和速記能力如何？

sentences.english: The young lady had been Maxwell's stenographer for a year.
sentences.chinese: 年輕女郎給馬克斯韋爾當速記員已經有一年。

sentences.english: A paper and a pencil were in my hand, however, and Harned was dictating to me, giving me a speed test in shorthand.
sentences.chinese: 哈內德在給我口授着什麼，讓我做速記的速度測試。

sentences.english: He took down a speech in shorthand .
sentences.chinese: 他用速記法把演說記下來。

sentences.english: I write everything in longhand on yellow tablets while sitting on the sofa.
sentences.chinese: 所有的東西我都是坐在沙發上速記在黃色的筆記簿上。

sentences.english: Sophie quickly found some paper and copied it down longhand .
sentences.chinese: 索菲很快找了一張紙條，用速記法把它抄了下來。

sentences.english: Throughout his entire life, Dr. Gutzler had maintained close ties with stenography .
sentences.chinese: 古澤博士在他的一生中主要從事速記。

sentences.english: I have decided to learn shorthand.
I have attended typewriting and shorthand classes.
sentences.chinese: 我參加了打字與速記班。

sentences.english: She was elected a steno grapher of that meeting.
sentences.chinese: 她被選爲那次會議的速記員。

definition: lit. to fall behind Sun Shan 孫山|孙山[Sun1 Shan1] (who came last in the imperial examination) (idiom)/fig. to fail an exam/to fall behind (in a competition)
see 拔苗助長|拔苗助长[ba2 miao2 zhu4 zhang3]
lit. to sleep on brushwood and taste gall (like King Gou Jian of Yue 勾踐|勾践[Gou1 Jian4]), in order to recall one's humiliations) (idiom)/fig. to maintain one's resolve for revenge
to praise the virtue of sb or sth while concealing their faults
lit. deal sincerely and fairly (idiom); frank and open-minded/plain speaking/Let's talk frankly and openly between ourselves./to put one's cards on the table
Pang Juan (-342 BC), military leader and political strategist of the School of Diplomacy 縱橫家|纵横家[Zong4 heng2 jia1] during the Warring States Period (425-221 BC)
to run a newspaper/to publish a newspaper
steady as Mt Tai/as safe as houses
with a will, you can achieve anything (idiom); cf 精誠所至，金石為開|精诚所至，金石为开[jing1 cheng2 suo3 zhi4 , jin1 shi2 wei4 kai1]
